title: The Great Gatsby
book_summary: The story primarily concerns the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion and obsession with the beautiful former debutante Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book_summary: The story takes place during three years of the Great Depression in the fictional Maycomb, Alabama.
A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about totalitarianism.

title: Pride and Prejudice
book_summary: A romantic novel of manners set in the early 19th century.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
book_summary: The novel details two days in the life of 16-year-old Holden Caulfield after he has been expelled from prep school.

title: The Hobbit
book_summary: The story is set in a time 'Between the Dawn of FÃ¦rie and the Dominion of Men'.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
book_summary: The story follows a young boy, Harry Potter, who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday.

title: Moby-Dick; or, The Whale
book_summary: The novel is known for its detailed descriptions of whaling and life aboard a 19th-century whaling ship.

title: The Lord of the Rings
book_summary: The title refers to the story's main antagonist, the Dark Lord Sauron, who had in an earlier age created the One Ring to rule the other Rings of Power as the ultimate weapon in his campaign to conquer and rule all of Middle-earth.
